summary.para: Retrieves the value that specifies if an audio track has an additional pre-emphasis added to the audio data.

param.name: value
param.para: Value that specifies if an audio track has an additional pre-emphasis added to the audio data.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the value for the bit that represents the current digital audio copy setting on the resulting media. Please see the enumeration for possible values.

param.name: value
param.para: The current digital audio copy setting.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This property may only be set for tracks containing audio data.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) currently associated with the track. This property value defaults to NULL (or a zero-length string) and may only be set for tracks containing audio data.

param.name: value
param.para: The ISRC currently associated with the track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: The format of the ISRC is provided to the caller formatted per ISRC standards (DIN-31-621) recommendations, such as "US-K7Y-98-12345". When set, the provided string may optionally exclude all the '-' characters.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of user sectors in this track.

param.name: value
param.para: The number of user sectors in this track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: The end of the track is typically the StartingLBA plus the SectorCount. The start of the next track includes both of these properties plus any required pregap or postgap.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of data provided for the sectors in this track. For more detail on the possible sector types, see .

param.name: value
param.para: A pointer to a enumeration that specifies the type of data provided for the sectors on the track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the LBA of the first user sectors in this track.

param.name: value
param.para: The LBA of the first user sectors in this track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: Most tracks also include a pregap and postgap, which are not included in this value.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the one-based index of the tracks on the disc.

param.name: value
param.para: The one-based index associated with this track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Retrieves the track number for this track.

param.name: value
param.para: The track number for this track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: While this value is often identical to the TrackIndex property, it is possible for pure audio discs to start with a track other than track number 1. This means that the more general formula is that this value is ( TrackIndex + FirstTrackNumber - 1).

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Sets the value that specifies if an audio track has an additional pre-emphasis added to the audio data prior to being written to CD.

param.name: value
param.para: Value that specifies if an audio track has an additional pre-emphasis added to the audio data.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Sets the digital audio copy "Allowed" bit to one of three values on the resulting media. Please see the enumeration for additional information on each possible value.

param.name: value
param.para: The digital audio copy setting value to assign.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: This property may only be set for tracks containing audio data.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Sets the International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) currently associated with the track. This property value defaults to NULL (or a zero-length string) and may only be set for tracks containing audio data.

param.name: value
param.para: The ISRC to associate with the track.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: The format of the ISRC is provided to the caller formatted per ISRC standards (DIN-31-621) recommendations, such as "US-K7Y-98-12345". When set, the provided string may optionally exclude all the '-' characters.

This method is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

summary.para: Use this interface to track per-track properties that are applied to CD media.

remarks.para: This interface is supported in Windows Server 2003 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2), and Windows Vista via the Windows Feature Pack for Storage. All features provided by this update package are supported natively in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.
